1.text: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

2.text: Speak to all the congregation of the children of Israel, and say to them, Ye shall be holy: for I the LORD your God am holy.

3.text: Ye shall fear every man his mother and his father, and keep my sabbaths: I am the LORD your God.

4.text: Turn ye not to idols, nor make to yourselves molten gods: I am the LORD your God.

5.text: And if ye offer a sacrifice of peace-offerings to the LORD, ye shall offer it at your own will.

6.text: It shall be eaten the same day ye offer it, and on the morrow: and if aught shall remain until the third day, it shall be burnt in the fire.

7.text: And if it shall be eaten at all on the third day, it is abominable; it shall not be accepted.

8.text: Therefore every one that eateth it shall bear his iniquity, because he hath profaned the hallowed thing of the LORD; and that soul shall be cut off from among his people.

9.text: And when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not wholly reap the corners of thy field, neither shalt thou gather the gleanings of thy harvest.

10.text: And thou shalt not glean thy vineyard, neither shalt thou gather every grape of thy vineyard; thou shalt leave them for the poor and stranger: I am the LORD your God.

11.text: Ye shall not steal, neither deal falsely, neither lie one to another.

12.text: And ye shall not swear by my name falsely, neither shalt thou profane the name of thy God: I am the LORD.

13.text: Thou shalt not defraud thy neighbor, neither rob him: the wages of him that is hired shall not abide with thee all night until the morning.

14.text: Thou shalt not curse the deaf, nor put a stumbling-block before the blind, but shalt fear thy God: I am the LORD.

15.text: Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment; thou shalt not respect the person of the poor, nor honor the person of the mighty: but in righteousness shalt thou judge thy neighbor.

16.text: Thou shalt not go up and down as a tale-bearer among thy people; neither shalt thou stand against the blood of thy neighbor; I am the LORD.

17.text: Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thy heart: thou shalt in any wise rebuke thy neighbor, and not suffer sin upon him.

18.text: Thou shalt not avenge, nor bear any grudge against the children of thy people, but thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself; I am the LORD.

19.text: Ye shall keep my statutes. Thou shalt not let thy cattle engender with a diverse kind: Thou shalt not sow thy field with mingled seed: neither shall a garment mingled of linen and woolen come upon thee.

20.text: And whoever lieth carnally with a woman that is a bond-maid betrothed to a husband, and not at all redeemed, nor freedom given her; she shall be scourged: they shall not be put to death, because she was not free.

21.text: And he shall bring his trespass-offering to the LORD, to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, even a ram for a trespass-offering.

22.text: And the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass-offering before the LORD for his sin which he hath done; and the sin which he hath done shall be forgiven him.

23.text: And when ye shall come into the land, and shall have planted all manner of trees for food; then ye shall count its fruit as uncircumcised: three years shall it be as uncircumcised to you: it shall not be eaten of.

24.text: But in the fourth year all its fruit shall be holy to praise the LORD with.

25.text: And in the fifth year shall ye eat of its fruit, that it may yield to you its increase: I am the LORD your God.

26.text: Ye shall not eat any thing with the blood: neither shall ye use enchantment, nor observe times.

27.text: Ye shall not round the corners of your heads, neither shalt thou mar the corners of thy beard.

28.text: Ye shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor print any marks upon you: I am the LORD.

29.text: Do not prostitute thy daughter to cause her to be a harlot: lest the land should fall to lewdness, and the land become full of wickedness.

30.text: Ye shall keep my sabbaths, and reverence my sanctuary: I am the LORD.

31.text: Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.

32.text: Thou shalt rise up before the hoary head, and honor the face of the old man, and fear thy God: I am the LORD.

33.text: And if a stranger shall sojourn with thee in your land, ye shall not oppress him.

34.text: But the stranger that dwelleth with you shall be to you as one born among you, and thou shalt love him as thyself; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.

35.text: Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment, in weight, in measure of length or of capacity.

36.text: Just balances, just weights, a just ephah, and a just hin shall ye have: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt.

37.text: Therefore shall ye observe all my statutes, and all my judgments, and do them: I am the LORD.
